item.title: AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D Specs Leak Ahead Of Release
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/amd-ryzen-7-9800x3d-specs-leak-ahead-of-release/

The specs for the AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D CPU have been leaked online ahead of the processor’s official release. European comparison website Geizhals (first spotted by Tom’s Hardware) has posted the full specs of the new chip that shows some solid improvements over its predecessors.

Before getting into the leaked specs, it’s worth noting that none of this has been officially confirmed by AMD. That means that some of the details could be slightly different from the actual information.

According to the leaked specs, the Ryzen 7 9800X3D features a base clock speed of 4.7 GHz with a boost clock of up to 5.2 GHz. The base clock comes in at 500 MHz higher than the 7800X3D. It also features a TDP of 120W along with 8MB of L2 cache and 96MB of L3 cache.

As far as pricing goes, that wasn’t part of the specs leak. However, recent rumors suggest that it will cost $479, $30 more than the 7800X3D. The CPU is expected to release November 7.

You can check out the rest of the leaked specs for the processor below:

The Ryzen 7 9800X3D is one of the more anticipated CPU releases in recent years from AMD, and with the leaked specs, it looks like AMD’s rise with PC owners could continue.

What do you think of the specs for the AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D CPU? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming Tech, read our full review of the new Intel Core Ultra 9 285K CPU.

item.title: Wolverine Creative Director Leaves To Join Xbox’s Perfect Dark
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/wolverine-creative-director-leaves-to-join-xboxs-perfect-dark/

The creative director of Marvel’s Wolverine has reportedly left the game to work for Xbox and its Perfect Dark reboot.

According to Stephen Totilo’s Game File, Brian Horton left Insomniac over the summer. He is now the creative director on Perfect Dark, which is being developed by The Initiative.

An Xbox representative told Game File that Horton will be “bringing his wealth of experience to the upcoming reboot of the classic secret agent series”.

Totilo’s report states that Horton left Insomniac and Wolverine as part of creative changes around the game. Another move made was that Cameron Christian is no longer game director on Wolverine. Instead, he moves to a different, currently unknown, role within the studio.

Taking over as Wolverine’s game director and creative director are Mike Daly and Marcus Smith, respectively. The two were the leads on Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart.

Insider Gaming reached out to Sony for comment on the changes, but no response was received.

Perfect Dark has seen a number of reported issues with development over the years. However, this summer saw a new look at the game released during Xbox’s Summer Showcase.

Regarding Wolverine, the last look fans received came via the major Insomniac leak from 2023. The game was first announced in 2021, but Insomniac may be “gearing up” to showcase more of the game in the near future.

As far as a release date for Perfect Dark or Wolverine, none have been officially announced. Rumors suggest that Wolverine could release sometime in 2025.

What do you think of the shakeup at both PlayStation’s Wolverine and Xbox’s Perfect Dark? Let us know down below, or in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about just how big the launch of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 was for the franchise. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
